awd_titl_txt: EAGER: Talk of the Town App for Research
awd_abstract_narration:
Classrooms are not the only places where children learn. Children engage in ‘informal learning’ every day just by spending time with their family and peers. However, while researchers know this learning occurs, less is known about the underlying science of this learning -- how this learning works. This is so because investigators lack access and the means to gather relevant data. The goal of this project is to develop a technical solution, a mobile-based research platform called “Talk of the Town”  that will provide a window into children’s informal learning.  The development of this tool is significant because it will make possible access to data that are important  for developing and testing educational interventions at scale, and it will provide access to much more diverse samples than are typically studied in laboratories,  homes, and science museums.  

The goal of this proof-of- concept project is to develop an open-source mobile-based platform called “Talk of the Town,” which consists of two components. The first component is a mobile app that will be used to obtain consent, administer onboarding demographic questionnaires. Critically, the app can prompt parents to record conversations with their children in different contexts and different locations. It does so by using conversational prompts about specific topics, including prompts which can be triggered by proximity to specific landmarks. The second component will be a server that will be used to store the recorded conversations, and administer tasks to different app users based on responses to the onboarding questionnaire and tasks the participating family has completed in the past. These newly developed technical capabilities will be able to support observational designs, as well as experimental manipulations and teaching interventions. Importantly, they will open a window into aspects of children’s learning and development that have been overlooked and/or understudied

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
The Talk of the Town project developed and laid the groundwork for a novel mobile phone app platform designed to advance research on children’s learning and development in naturalistic environments. Traditionally, research on early learning has relied on laboratory-based or highly controlled settings, which often limit participation and exclude the informal contexts where much of children’s critical learning takes place. The Talk of the Town app represents a transformative tool for bridging this gap by providing a way for families to contribute to scientific research from their own homes and communities.


Intellectual Merit:

This project addressed significant technological and methodological challenges in the learning sciences. The app enables researchers to prompt parent-child conversations about STEM-related topics through geo-tagged locations or scripted scenarios, thereby facilitating the study of naturalistic learning experiences. Key technical milestones achieved include developing a robust backend database for research data management, enhancing the app’s user interface for accessibility and engagement, and ensuring reliability across Android and iOS devices. Importantly, the app creates a scalable and replicable platform for gathering high-quality, ecologically valid data from diverse families, a longstanding limitation in developmental research.


Broader Impacts:

The Talk of the Town app has the potential to transform how research is conducted and how families engage with STEM learning. By lowering barriers to participation—such as eliminating the need for home visits or lab-based testing—the app increases opportunities for families from diverse socioeconomic and geographic backgrounds to participate in scientific research in the learning sciences. This inclusivity improves the generalizability of findings and fosters broader representation. Additionally, the app will support studies that encourage families to engage in STEM-rich conversations in natural settings like parks, museums, or at home, which can spark curiosity and support children’s informal STEM learning.

Talk of the Town lays the groundwork for future research that combines experimental and observational designs to study early learning experiences at scale. Its use of mobile technology serves as a model for engaging families in research, creating a mutually beneficial relationship between scientists and communities. This platform will support not only the advancement of scientific understanding but can also provide families with valuable tools to promote children’s curiosity and STEM engagement in their everyday lives.
